definitions.definition: A piece of metal placed in a horse's mouth and connected to the reins to direct the animal.
examples: A horse hates having a bit put in its mouth.

definitions.definition: A rotary cutting tool , fitted to a drill , brace , or router , used to bore or drill holes or to remove material from the profile of the workpiece .
Applied to a various small units of currency and coins.

subdefinitions.definition: ( dated , British ) A coin of a specified value.

( historical , US and Canada ) A unit of currency worth one eighth of a dollar , originally of a Spanish dollar but later also US or Canadian; also, a coin with this value, in particular the silver Spanish real .
( obsolete , US and Canada ) A coin of a value similar but not equal to this, in particular the ‘ short bit ’, i.e. the ten- cent piece or dime .

( historical ) A unit of currency and coin of the British West Indies worth six black dogs , originally equal to one-eighth of a Spanish dollar but later increasingly debased to one tenth , one eleventh , one twelfth , etc.
( historical ) A unit of currency of the Dutch West Indies in the early 20th century, worth one fifth of a cent .

definitions.definition: A small amount of something.
examples: There were bits of paper all over the floor.
Does your leg still hurt? —Just a bit now.
I've done my bit ; I expect you to do yours.

definitions.definition: ( informal ) Specifically , a small amount of time.
examples: I'll be there in a bit ; I need to take care of something first.
He was here just a bit ago, but it looks like he's stepped out.

definitions.definition: ( informal ) A small fraction above a whole number.
examples: The movie lasted for two and a bit hours.

definitions.definition: ( in the plural , informal , sports ) Fractions of a second .
examples: The 400 metres race was won in 47 seconds and bits .

definitions.definition: A portion of something.
examples: I'd like a big bit of cake, please.

definitions.definition: Somewhat; something, but not very great; also used like jot and whit to express the smallest degree. See also a bit .
examples: Am I bored? Not a bit of it!

definitions.definition: A replaceable tip for a hand tool or power tool , comprising the portion that drives a fastener .
( slang ) A prison sentence , especially a short one.
An excerpt of material making up part of a show, comedy routine, etc.
examples: His bit about video games was not nearly as entertaining as the other segments of his show.

definitions.definition: ( slang ) A gag or put-on ; a humorous conceit , especially when insistently presented as true.
examples: Are you serious, or is this a bit ?

definitions.definition: Ellipsis of bit part .
examples: She acted her bit in the opening scene.

definitions.definition: The part of a key which enters the lock and acts upon the bolt and tumblers .
The cutting iron of a plane .
The bevelled front edge of an axehead along which the cutting edge runs.
( BDSM ) A gag of a style similar to a bridle .
( MLE ) A gun .

definitions.definition: A binary digit , generally represented as a 1 or 0.
The smallest unit of storage in a digital computer , consisting of a binary digit.
Any datum that may take on one of exactly two values.
examples: permission bits in a file system

definitions.definition: A unit of measure for information entropy .
A microbitcoin , or a millionth of a bitcoin (0.000001 BTC).

main_definition: ( mathematics , computing ) A binary digit , generally represented as a 1 or 0.
secondary_definitions: ( computing ) The smallest unit of storage in a digital computer , consisting of a binary digit.
( information theory , cryptography ) Any datum that may take on one of exactly two values.
( information theory ) A unit of measure for information entropy .
A microbitcoin , or a millionth of a bitcoin (0.000001 BTC).
